div.p: The mission of Ririe School District #252, in partnership with the community, is to prepare students for the future enabling every student to gain knowledge and skills, to develop confidence, to value lifelong learning, and to become responsible, contributing members of our changing world.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-ibL1re purZT-AhqUyc-ibL1re pSzOP-AhqUyc-ibL1re jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: Please visit our new page for updates on the Coronavirus.

div.p: See our 2020 Bond Information page here.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Do you have a question about the bond that you would like the school district to answer? Submit your questions HERE.
Want to see previously answered questions? Click HERE.
Want to join the email list?If you would like to receive emails from the Ririe School District, please CLICK HERE.

Ririe School District would like to address some information that has been posted on social media regarding the proposed construction of an athletic facility with our upcoming bond election on May 19th. In the February board meeting, a decision was made to build an athletic facility rather than a dedicated wrestling room. After a lengthy discussion, the board members agreed that an athletic facility would benefit the most significant number of students and provide opportunities for community use. The athletic facility will serve as a dedicated wrestling room during the wrestling season, and be available for all groups to schedule the remainder of the year. These groups include P.E. classes, clubs, cheer, volleyball, football, cross country, track, and softball. Other events will consist of youth sports, city league, and community gatherings. Two athletic facilities at our Jr/Sr High School will also provide opportunities to host various tournaments throughout the year. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Jeff Gee or Blake Jenson in the district office at 208-538-7482.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: The Distinguished Young Women program, which was scheduled for Saturday, April 4, has been postponed. We will reevaluate the situation after Spring Break and send out information about rescheduling the event.

hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: A Declaration of Vacancy for School Board Trustee Zone 2 was made on January 8, 2020 at the Regular School Board Meeting and was opened up for the required ninety (90) day time period to any patron within that zone to submit in a Letter of Interest. There being no interest during the 90 day period, the Board has now opened the Zone 2 Board Trustee Position up to anyone living within the Ririe Joint School District 252 boundaries as written in State Statute 33-504. Anyone from within the Ririe 252 School District boundaries who is interested in serving on the School Board for the remainder of the Zone 2 term will need to submit a Letter of Interest to Kristi Hamilton at the District Office 13809 N 130th W Ririe, ID 83443. You may also email your letter of interest to: khamilton@ririe252.org or snail mail to: Ririe Joint School District C/O Kristi Hamilton PO Box 508 Ririe, ID 83443. Please call 208-538-7482 for more information.

On November 12th, 2019 a broken water line was discovered in the records room of the old gym. When the water was discovered it had already caused serious damage to the records room, gym floor, and locker rooms. After some investigation it was determined that a tripped breaker caused the heater in the records room to shut down causing the water pipe to freeze and break. Contractors have been working to remove damaged flooring and drywall. Once the remediation process has been completed the districts insurance will close the claim. At this point no decisions have been made for the future of the building.

If you have any additional concerns, please contact your local board member, Superintendent Jeff Gee, or Director of Operations Blake Jenson at 208-538-7482 Option 1, or by emailing bjenson@ririe252.org

div.p: State education leaders recently recognized top performing schools in the State of Idaho. Here is how they recognized Ririe Schools:

ol.li: Goalmaker- Ririe Jr/Sr High School in English Language and Graduation Rate.
Goalmaker- Ririe Elementary in English Language Growth.
Top performer- Ririe Jr/Sr High School for posting achievement in the 90th percentile in College & Career Readiness.
Top performer- Ririe Elementary for posting achievement in the 90th percentile in Engagement.
